info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 6:37PM EDT until June 12 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Grayson.
* WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Horse Creek, Guffey Creek, Houndshell Branch, Fox Creek, Grassy Creek, Helton Creek, Bridle Creek, Comers Creek, Dickey Creek, Jerry Creek and Bear Branch. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sugar Grove... Mouth Of Wilson... Whitetop... Troutdale... Rugby... Volney... Grayson Highlands State Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING
